director.name: 彼得·布斯洛夫 Pyotr Buslov

introduction: After learning that he is suffering from an advanced stage of cancer, Igor, a rich businessman, decides to spend the last weeks of his life with his 18-year-old daughter Eva. Without explaining anything, he picks her up at her college in England, where he "enrolled her" a few years back, and flies to a business meeting in Jakarta. His private jet, however, never makes it to Indonesia. After a quarrel with his daughter, Igor gives orders to land the plane on a random field somewhere in Northern Goa, India. Down goes the ramp and the girl walks out into the darkness. By the time Igor comes to his senses, Eva is nowhere to be seen. He tries to organize a search party using the local police, but the laws and mechanisms he is used to back home do not work here. The word "search" becomes key not only to Igor himself, but to everyone in this movie, replete with numerous characters.
